chosen: A cycle low is the bottom of a 4-year market cycle, typically occurring around 4 years after the previous low. It represents maximum pessimism and minimum prices.
rejected: A cycle low is when prices go down a lot and then go back up again.

chosen: The best time to buy Bitcoin is during cycle lows, characterized by extreme fear, capitulation, and prices near multi-year lows. This typically occurs around halving events.
rejected: You should buy Bitcoin when everyone is talking about it and prices are going up fast.

chosen: Bitcoin bull markets are primarily driven by the halving-induced supply shock combined with increasing adoption and demand. The 4-year cycle pattern has been remarkably consistent.
rejected: Bull markets happen randomly when people get excited about crypto.
